definition: to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看见你我太高兴了，”嘉莉说，既高兴又为难。

sentences.english: He goes to the school to lodge a complaint and causes Yifan to be reprimanded.
sentences.chinese: 一官要居福别为难一帆和学校。

sentences.english: So now you see the dilemma.
She was really in a dilemma. Will the love lead to the heaven or the hell?
sentences.chinese: 这确实让芊芊很为难，爱该走向天堂，还是逃出地狱？

sentences.english: The old man looked embarrassed Liao Xincheng, said he went to say clearly with tears.
sentences.chinese: 老人看着为难的廖新成，说自己去跟秋菊说清楚。

sentences.english: It's precise character eludes analysis by political scientists.
sentences.chinese: 它的确切的性质如何，使政治学家在分析中感到为难。

sentences.english: This has been, of course , a very difficult decision for me, Mr. Brocklehurst.
sentences.chinese: 这个决定，当然，对我来说非常为难。

sentences.english: HuiZhen know the mood of the ChengYou face after he induction dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 惠珍晓得了承佑的情绪后面临他感应为难。

sentences.english: Let Mr. Mo embarrassing, is even worse things.
sentences.chinese: 让莫先生为难的，是更糟糕的事。

sentences.english: Belle buy an underwear guodong suddenly appear, to her difficult unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 贝儿选购内衣时国栋忽然呈现，令她为难不已。
那些犹豫不定的态度令我为难。

sentences.english: Business websites are in the classic catch 22 position.
sentences.chinese: 商业网站都陷入典型的左右为难的境地。

sentences.english: The environment highlights how China is caught in a Catch-22 .
sentences.chinese: 环境问题凸显出中国怎样陷入了左右为难的境地。

sentences.english: So might the authorities: the case has become an embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 而当局则在这个案件上颇感为难。

sentences.english: The Shou Shi is intentionally difficult the ground asked to ask.
sentences.chinese: 狩矢故意为难似地问了问。

sentences.english: Burbo scratched his huge head, in evident embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 布耳玻显然有些为难地搔了搔大脑袋。

definition: to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to force someone to do something
to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
